content: You taught me the courage of stars before you left: how light carries on endlessly, even after death. With shortness of breath, you explained the infinite and how rare and beautiful it is to even exist. I couldn't help but ask for you to say it all again. I tried to write it down, but I could never find a pen. I'd give anything to hear you say it one more time: that the universe was made just to be seen by my eyes.
author: Sleeping at Last
